No. F. 22(10)/2016-Legis.—The following Act of Majlis-e-Shoora, 
(Parliament) received the assent of the President on the 26th April, 2017 is hereby 
published for general information: 
ACT No. XIV OF 2017 
An Act to provide for establishment of the Pakistan Council for 
Science and Technology 
WHEREAS it is expedient to provide for the establishment of Pakistan Council 
for Science and Technology to advise the Government on national policies on science, 
technology and innovation for building up a strong and self-reliant science and 
technology system and its effective working directed towards achievement of national 
goals and in particular the welfare of the people, economic growth and security of 
Pakistan; 
(123) 
[594 (2017)/Ex Gaz.] 	 Price : Rs. 10.50 
124 	 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., MAY2, 2017 	[PART I 
It is hereby enacted as follows: 	
1. 	Short title, extent and commencement.- (1) This Act may be called 
the Pakistan Council for Science and Technology Act, 2017. 
It extends to the whole of Pakistan. 
It shall come into force at once. 	
2. 	Definitions.- In this Act, unless there is anything repugnant in the 
subject or context, 
"Board" means the Board of Governors of the Council; 
"Chairperson" means head of the Council; 
"Council" means Pakistan Council for Science and Technology; 
"Executive Committee" means Executive Committee of the Board 
constituted under section 11; 
"expert committee" means an expert committee of the Council 
constituted under section 14; 
"member" means a member of the Board; 
"prescribed" means prescribed by regulations made under this Act; 
"President" means President of the Board; 
"regulations" means regulations made under this Act; 
"Resolution" means the Resolution notified vide Notification No. 3(5)/ 
82-NSC, dated the 16th June, 1987 for constitution of the devised 
council dissolved under section 22; and 
"Vice-President" means Vice-President of the Board. 	
3. 	Establishment of the Council.- (1) On commencement of this Act, 
there shall stand established a Council to be called as Pakistan Council for Science 
and Technology in accordance with the provisions of the Act. 
The Council shall be a body corporate having perpetual succession 
and a common seal, with power, subject to the provisions of this Act, to acquire, sell 
and hold property, and shall by the said name sue and be sued through Chairperson. 
The headquarters of the Council shall be at Islamabad and the Council 
may establish regional or sub-offices as required. 
PART I] 	 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., MAY2, 2017 	 125 
4. 	Functions of the Council.—The Council shall— 
advise the Federal Government on all matters relating to the 
development of science and technology in Pakistan; 
undertake policy research, organize study groups or task forces, 
formulate policy proposals; monitoring and evaluation of science, 
technology and innovation policy for achieving targets for the overall 
development of science and technology in the country; 
identify priority areas for research and development keeping in view 
futuristic developments of science and technology; 
constitute expert committees in various disciplines for preparation of 
reports on policies and issues of national importance in respect of 
science and technology; 
collect, update statistibs and maintain database on science and 
technology potentials of the country; 
take measures for effective collaboration among academia, research 
and development organizations and industry for development of 
indigenous products or technologies; 
evaluation of national research and development acticrities including 
output of individuals and institutions and to grant research productivity 
awards or incentives thereof; 
promote collaboration among national and international organizations 
for capacity-building and other policy initiatives in the field of science 
and technology and to enter into memoranda of understanding, contracts 
etc., in accordance with the Rules of Business, 1973; 
participate in national science and technology planning and development 
activities and providing advice on selection of projects; 
(D 	act as Secretariat of the National Commission for Science and 
Technology (NCST); and 
(k) 	perform any other functions as may be assigned to it by the Federal 
Government. 
5. 	Management.—The management of the Council shall comprise— 
(a) 	Board of Governors;

The Chairperson shall act as Secretary of the Board. 
The Federal Government may, by notification in the official Gazette, 
increase or decrease the number of members of the Board. 
The Board may co-opt any other professional or expert. 
8. 	Functions and powers of the Board.—(1) The Board shall— 
review and approve annual, long-term plans, policies and programmes 
of the Council; 
approve the annual development and non-development budget of the 
Council; 
create or abolish posts of such officers and staff and engage such 
consultants or experts as it may consider necessary for efficient 
performance of the functions of the Council, on such terms and 
conditions as may be prescribed; 
make regulations for the efficient conduct of the affairs of the Council; 
and 
(e) 	recommend to the Government to terminate the tenure of the 
Chairperson before its expiry in case of unsatisfactory performance. 
128 	 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., MAY2, 2017 	[PART1 
(2) 	The Board may, by general or special order in writing, direct that such 
of its powers shall, in such circumstances and under such conditions, if any, as may 
be specified in the order, be exercised, by the Executive Committee, Chairperson or 
an officer of the Council. 
9. 	Tenn of office of members.—(1) Save as hereinafter provided, a 
member, other than an ex officio member, shall hold office for a period of three 
years from the date of his nomination and shall be eligible for re-nomination for a 
further period not exceeding another term. 
A person who becomes, or is nominated to be, a member by virtue of 
his holding an office or appointment shall cease to be a member when he ceases to 
hold that office or appointment. 
A member, other than an ex officio member, may at any time resign 
his membership by writing under his hand addressed to the Federal Government. 
A vacancy caused by resignation or any other reason shall be filled by 
nomination of a person qualified to fill such vacancy. 
No act or proceeding of the Board shall be invalid merely on the ground 
of existence of a vacancy in constitution of the Board. 
10. 	Meetings of the Board.—(1) Save as hereinafter provided, the Board 
shall regulate the procedure for its meetings. 
Meetings of the Board shall be called and presided by its President or 
in his absence by the Vice-President on such date, time and place as deemed fit 
provided that at least two meetings shall be held in a year. 
At least ten members shall constitute the quorum for a meeting of the 
Board. 
11. 	Executive Committee of the Board.—(1)Notwithstanding anything 
contained in this Act, the Executive Committee shall take decisions on behalf of the 
Board subject to ratification by the Board at its meeting immediately following the 
meeting of the Executive Committee unless otherwise authorized by the Board. 
(2) • The Executive Committee shall comprise the following members, 
namely:— 
Chairperson of the Council 	 Chairperson 
one member to be nominated by the Board 	 Member

The Secretary of the Council shall act as the Secretary of the Executive 
Committee. 
Subject to the provisions of this Act and regulations made in this behalf 
and such general or special directions as may, from time to time, be given by the 
Board, the Executive Committee shall deal with any matter as authorized by the 
Board. 
Chairperson of the Council.—The Chairperson shall be an eminent 
scientist or engineer holding a Ph.D degree with sufficient relevant experience to 
be appointed by the Prime Minister on recommendations of the Federal Government 
for a term of three years extendable for another term on such terms and conditions 
as may be prescribed. 
Powers and functions of the Chairperson.—The Chairperson, who 
shall be the Chief Executive Officer of the Council, shall work under the general 
policy guidelines of the Board and have such powers, functions and duties as may be 
conferred or vested in him by or under this Act, including— 
formulation of research policies, plans and their submission to the Board 
for approval; 
protection of all assets of the Council including intellectual property 
assets; 
preparation of annual report of the Council for subthission to the Federal 
Government; 
for the purpose of ensuring efficient functioning of the Council and to 
facilitate its day-to-day functions, delegation to the Secretary or other 
officers of the Council, such of his powers or duties as he may consider 
necessary from time to time; and 
(e) appointment of such officers and employees subject to the provisions 
of relevant regulations, as may be necessary for efficient performance 
of functions of the Council on such terms and conditions as may be 
prescribed. 
130 	 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., MAY2, 2017 	[PART I 
14. Expert committees.—(1) The Council may constitute expert 
committees, in important scientific, technological and engineering disciplines to review 
current status and suggest policy measures for their future development. 
(2) The expert committees shall have such powers and perform such 
functions as may be assigned by the Council. 
15. Fund of the Council—There shall be a Fund of the Council to be 
called the PCST Fund to which shall be credited— 
funds of the devised council being dissolved under section 22, which 
shall stand transferred to the Council; 
grants from the Govertunents; 
donations and endowments; 
hinds generated through its own resources; and 
research grants. 
16. Budget and accounts.—(l) The Chairperson shall, in respect of 
each financial year, submit for the approval of the Board, a statement showing all 
the expenditures incurred during the year alongwith estimated receipts and 
expenditures for the next financial year. 
The Council shall, by such date and in such form as may be prescribed, 
submit to the Federal Government for approval of its budget for each financial year 
showing the estimated receipts and expenditures and the sums which are likely to be 
required from the Federal Government during the financial year. 
The accounts of the Council shall be maintained in such form and 
manner as determined by the Federal Government. 
The accounts of the Council shall be audited by the Auditor-General 
of Pakistan. 
17. Appointment of officers, staff, etc.—(1) The Council may, from 
time to time, appoint such officers and staff as it may consider necessary for the 
efficient performance of its functions, on such terms and conditions as may be 
prescribed. 
(2) The Council may engage experts or consultants on such terms and 
conditions as may be prescribed. 
PART!] 	 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., MAY2, 2017 	 131 
18. 	Submission of reports. etc.—The Council shall submit to the Federal 
Government at such time and at such intervals, as the Federal Government may 
specify,— 
annual report on working of the Council; 
such periodical reports and summaries as may be required by the 
Federal Government; 
such periodical returns, accounts, statements and statistics as may be 
required by the Federal Government; 
information and comments asked for by the Federal Government on 
any specific point; 
copies of the documents required by the Fcderal Government; and 
original documents required by the Federal Government for examination 
or any other purpose. 
19. Directives from the Federal Government.—The Federal 
Goveriunent may, from time to time, issue to the Council such directives and orders 
in writing, as it may consider necessary for carrying out the purpose of this Act and 
the Council shall be bound to follow and carry out such directives and orders. 
20. 	Declaration of fidelity and secrecy.—Every member, expert, officer 
or other employee of the Council shall make such declaration of fidelity and secrecy 
as may be prescribed. 
21. 	Continuance of certain rules, etc.—All rules, regulations and bye- 
laws related to the Council and in force immediately before the commencement of 
this Act shall, mutatis mutandis and so far as they are not inconsistent with any of 
the provisions of this Act, apply and continue in force until repealed or amended or 
altered. 
22. 	Repeal and Savings.—(1) The Ministry of Science and Technology's 
Resolution notified vide No. 3(5)/82-NSC, dated the 16th June, 1987 is hereby 
repealed and the Pakistan Council of Science and Technology, hereinafter referred 
to as the devised council, reconstituted there under shall stand dissolved. 
(2) 	Upon dissolution of the devised council under sub-section (1),— 
(a) 	all assets, rights, powers, authorities, privileges and property, movable 
and immovable, cash and bank balance, reserve funds, investments 
and all other interests and rights in, liabilities and obligations of whatever 
kind of tlie devised council subsisting immediately before its dissolution 
shall stand transferred to and vest in the Council; 
132 	 THE GAZETTE OF PAKISTAN, EXTRA., MAY 2, 2017 	 [PART I 
(b) 	all officers and other employees of the devised council shall, 
notwithstanding anything contained in any law, agreement, deed, 
document or other instrument, stand transferred to the Council on the 
exercise of one-time irrevocable option to either remain a civil servant 
under the Civil Servants Act, 1973 (LXX1 of 1973) and shall be entitled 
to all the privileges and facilities of the Federal Government such as 
pension, gratuity, housing, health, etc. or to become an employee of , 
the Council, in accordance with their existing terms and condition of 
the service applicable to them and no officer or other employee whose 
services are so transferred shall be entitled to any compensation 
because of such transfer; 
all debts and obligations incurred or contracts entered into or rights 
acquired and all matters and things engaged to be done by, with or for 
the devised council before its dissolution shall be deemed to have been 
incurred, entered into, acquired or engaged to be done by, with or for 
the Council; 	 • 
all suits and other legal proceedings instituted by or against the devised 
council, before its dissolution, shall be deemed to be suits and 
proceedings by or against the Council and may be proceeded or 
otherwise dealt with accordingly; and 
all actions done by the devised council before the commencement of 
this Act shall be deemed to be done under this Act. 
Exemption from taxes.—Notwithstanding anything contained in the 
Income Tax Ordinance, 2001 (XLIX of 2001) or any other law for the time being in 
force relating to income tax, the Council shall not be liable to pay any such tax on its 
income, capital, profit, wealth, gifts or gains and any movable and immovable property. 
Power to make regulations.—The Board may, by notification in 
the official Gazette, make regulations, not inconsistent with the provisions of this 
Act, for carrying out the purposes of this Act. 
Removal of difficulties.—If any difficulty arises in giving effect to 
any provision of this Act, the Federal Government may make such order, not 
inconsistent with the provisions of this Act, as may appear to it to be necessary or 
expedient for the purpose of removal of such difficulty: 
Provided that such power shall not be exercised after expiry of two years 
from the commencement of this Act.
